org.opends.server.workflowelement

Class WorkflowElement<T extends WorkflowElementCfg>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.workflowelement.WorkflowElement<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of configuration handled by this workflow element.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LeafWorkflowElement

    public abstract class WorkflowElement<T extends WorkflowElementCfg>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    This class defines the super class for all the workflow elements. A workflow element is a task in a workflow. A workflow element can wrap a physical repository such as a local backend, a remote LDAP server or a local LDIF file. A workflow element can also be used to route operations. This is the case for load balancing and distribution. And workflow element can be used in a virtual environment to transform data (DN and attribute renaming, attribute value renaming...).

      Creates a new instance of the workflow element.

    • Method Detail

      • getObservableState

        protected ObservableWorkflowElementState getObservableState()
        Provides the observable state of the workflow element. This method is intended to be called by the WorkflowElementConfigManager that wants to notify observers that the workflow element state has changed (in particular when a workflow element has been disabled).
        Returns:
        the observable state of the workflow element

      • getObservableStatus

        protected ObservableWorkflowElementStatus getObservableStatus()
        Provides the observable status of the workflow element.
        Returns:
        the observable status of the workflow element.

      • registereForStateUpdate

        public static void registereForStateUpdate(WorkflowElement<?> we,
                           java.lang.String weid,
                           java.util.Observer observer)
        Registers with a specific workflow element to be notified when the workflow element state has changed. This notification system is mainly used to be warned when a workflow element is enabled or disabled.

        If the workflow element we is not null then the observer is registered with the list of objects to notify when we has changed.

        If the workflow element we is null then the observer is registered with a static list of objects to notify when a workflow element named weid is created.

        Parameters:
        we - the workflow element. If null then observer is registered with a list of workflow element identifiers.
        weid - the identifier of the workflow element. This parameter is useless when we is not null
        observer - the observer to notify when the workflow element state has been modified

      • deregistereForStateUpdate

        public static void deregistereForStateUpdate(WorkflowElement<?> we,
                             java.lang.String weid,
                             java.util.Observer observer)
        Deregisters an observer that was registered with a specific workflow element.

        If the workflow element we is not null then the observer is deregistered with the list of objects to notify when we has changed.

        If the workflow element we is null then the observer is deregistered with a static list of objects to notify when a workflow element named weid is created.

        Parameters:
        we - the workflow element. If null then observer is deregistered with a list of workflow element identifiers.
        weid - the identifier of the workflow element. This parameter is useless when we is not null
        observer - the observer to deregister

      • notifyStateUpdate

        public static void notifyStateUpdate(WorkflowElement<?> workflowElement)
        Notifies all the observers who want to be warn when a workflow element is created.
        Parameters:
        workflowElement - the newly created workflow element

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.lang.String workflowElementID,
              java.lang.String workflowElementTypeInfo)
        Initializes the instance of the workflow element.
        Parameters:
        workflowElementID - the workflow element identifier as defined in the configuration.
        workflowElementTypeInfo - an information to indicate the type of the current workflow element. For example "Backend" if the current workflow element is a local backend workflow element.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
          java.lang.Object arg)
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer

      • getWorkflowElementTypeInfo

        public java.lang.String getWorkflowElementTypeInfo()
        Get the type of the workflow element. The type is a string information indicating which type is the current workflow element. This information is intended to be used by tools for trace and debug purpose.
        Returns:
        the type of the workflow element.

      • isConfigurationAcceptable

        public boolean isConfigurationAcceptable(T configuration,
                                java.util.List<java.lang.String> unacceptableReasons)
        Indicates whether the provided configuration is acceptable for this workflow element.
        Parameters:
        configuration - The workflow element configuration for which to make the determination.
        unacceptableReasons - A list that may be used to hold the reasons that the provided configuration is not acceptable.
        Returns:
        true if the provided configuration is acceptable for this workflow element, or false if not.

      • finalizeWorkflowElement

        public void finalizeWorkflowElement()
        Performs any finalization that might be required when this workflow element is unloaded. No action is taken in the default implementation.

      • execute

        public abstract void execute(Operation operation)
                      throws CanceledOperationException
        Executes the workflow element for an operation.
        Parameters:
        operation - the operation to execute
        Throws:
        CanceledOperationException - if this operation should be canceled

      • isPrivate

        public boolean isPrivate()
        Indicates whether the workflow element encapsulates a private local backend.
        Returns:
        true if the workflow element encapsulates a private local backend, false otherwise

      • setPrivate

        protected void setPrivate(boolean isPrivate)
        Specifies whether the workflow element encapsulates a private local backend.
        Parameters:
        isPrivate - Indicates whether the workflow element encapsulates a private local backend.

        Modifies the saturation index of the workflow element.

      • registerForSaturationIndexUpdate

        public void registerForSaturationIndexUpdate(java.util.Observer observer)
        Registers an observer with the saturation index of the workflow element. The observer will be notified when the saturation index is updated.
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer to notify when the saturation index is modified.

      • deregisterForSaturationIndexUpdate

        public void deregisterForSaturationIndexUpdate(java.util.Observer observer)
        Deregisters an observer with the saturation index of the workflow element.
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer to deregister.

      • hasChildWorkflowElement

        public boolean hasChildWorkflowElement(WorkflowElement<?> element)
        Checks whether the tree of workflow elements below this one contains the provided workflow element.
        Parameters:
        element - The WorkflowElement we are looking for in the topology below this object.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • createStatistics

        public MonitorProvider<MonitorProviderCfg> createStatistics()
        Creates the statistics exposed by the workflow element. By default, workflow elements do not expose anything but specific implementations can override this method and provide their own stats.
        Returns:
        the statistics exposed by the workflow element.
